name: Dog Acronyms Online Trivia | Animals | 10 Questions

questions.text: Your dog show friend has a beautiful GSD. What does she have?
questions.explanation:
A German Shepherd Dog.

	Notice that "dog" is part of the official name of the breed!

questions.text: If you observed the following alphabet soup after a dog's name, what sport has he been competing in? Whatadog Iam AXJ MX EAJ
questions.explanation:
Agility.

	These are all agility titles in the United States.

questions.text: You hear that your neighbor is feeding his dog BARF. What is Fido really getting for supper?
questions.explanation:
Bones and raw food.

	The anagram originally meant 'bones and raw food' but has been changed to 'biologically appropriate raw food'. The content is still based on the original name, though.

questions.text: Your training class partner brags about his new SC. What breed could he have?
questions.explanation:
Greyhound.

	'SC' stands for 'Senior Courser', a title given to sighthounds that can follow a lure over open country.

questions.text: If you have a dog that loves to pick up ducks, what title could you train her for?
questions.explanation:
JH.

	JH- Junior Hunter- the lowest level of the AKC retriever hunt test program.

questions.text: Bonnie Doon has a HIC. She doesn't have hiccups, she has a
questions.explanation:
Herding Instinct Certificate.

	A certificate used to show that a herding breed dog at least recognizes a sheep.

questions.text: No one who is responsible in the dog world wants to be a BYB. What is a BYB?
questions.explanation:
'Backyard breeder'.

	A BYB is someone who breeds dogs without regard for genetic testing, screening of the new homes, improving the breed, etc. Often these are people who breed for cash, or to 'show the kids the miracle of life'.

questions.text: What is the highest obedience title granted?
If you need to track down an escaped convict, make sure that your bloodhound has a...
When you take your pup to the vet for his shots, he is likely to get which of the following?
questions.explanation:
DHLPP.

	Distemper, hepatitis, leptospirosis, parainfluenza, parvovirus vaccine
